A

accessData(int) - Static method in class stickypolicy.ServiceProvider
If the data is present in the databse, returns the first UserData object that matches the given hash and notifies client of access.

C

Client - Class in stickypolicy
This class creates a Client to send messages to the Server
Client(String, int) - Constructor for class stickypolicy.Client
Class constructor.
copyData(UserData) - Static method in class stickypolicy.ServiceProvider
Returns a single copy of a UserData object

D

deleteData(int) - Static method in class stickypolicy.ServiceProvider
Deletes all UserData objects with the given hash by changing the valid value associated with that data to false
deleteData(int) - Method in class stickypolicy.User
Sends a delete request Message along with the hash of the data object the user wants deleted

G

getCopy() - Method in class stickypolicy.Policy
Returns value of boolean variable for whether or not a User's data can be copied
getData() - Method in class stickypolicy.StickyHeader
Gets the data stored in the StickyHeader
getHash() - Method in class stickypolicy.Message
Returns the hash of the StickyHeader contained in the Message
getMessageType() - Method in class stickypolicy.Message
Returns the MessageType of the Message
getPolicy() - Method in class stickypolicy.StickyHeader
Gets the Policy stored in the StickyHeader
getShare() - Method in class stickypolicy.Policy
Returns value of boolean variable for whether or not a User's data can be shared outside of the Service Provider
getStickyHeader() - Method in class stickypolicy.Message
Returns the StickyHeader contained in the Message

I

interpretMessage(Message) - Static method in class stickypolicy.ServiceProvider
Interprets a Messages recieved from a User.

M

main(String[]) - Static method in class stickypolicy.ServiceProvider
Main method for running ServiceProvider.
main(String[]) - Static method in class stickypolicy.User
Main method for running a Client.
Message - Class in stickypolicy
This class creates Message objects which have all of the necessary fields to be sent between a User and a ServiceProvider
Message(MessageType) - Constructor for class stickypolicy.Message
Class constructor used only to send notifications between User and ServiceProvider without any data
Message(MessageType, int) - Constructor for class stickypolicy.Message
Class constructor for sending requests to delete the data associated with the included hash
Message(MessageType, StickyHeader, int) - Constructor for class stickypolicy.Message
Class constructor for uploading data

P

Policy - Class in stickypolicy
The Policy class stores User preferences regarding data access
Policy() - Constructor for class stickypolicy.Policy
Class constructor for a policy with everything set to default.
Policy(boolean, boolean) - Constructor for class stickypolicy.Policy
Class constructor with policy fields set to given values
Policy(Policy) - Constructor for class stickypolicy.Policy
Class constructor that will created a copy of the given policy object
printDatabase() - Static method in class stickypolicy.ServiceProvider
Returns a String representation of the current contents of the database

R

run() - Method in class stickypolicy.Server
Starts the server and continuously seeks clients looking to connect.
run() - Method in class stickypolicy.UserServer
Starts the server and continuously seeks clients trying to connect

S

sendMessage(Message) - Method in class stickypolicy.Client
Sends a message of type Message to the ServiceProvider
Server - Class in stickypolicy
This class creates a Server to continuously recieve messages from a Client
Server(int) - Constructor for class stickypolicy.Server
Class contructor initializes the ServerSocket
ServiceProvider - Class in stickypolicy
This class simulates a ServiceProvider with a database to store user data
ServiceProvider() - Constructor for class stickypolicy.ServiceProvider
Class contructor which initializes database but does not initialize server and client
setCopy(boolean) - Method in class stickypolicy.Policy
Sets the value of variable that allows copying of the User's data
setShare(boolean) - Method in class stickypolicy.Policy
Sets the value of variable that allows sharing of the User's data outside of the ServiceProvider
startServers(int, String, int) - Static method in class stickypolicy.ServiceProvider
Creates and starts the ServiceProvider's server and client
startServers(int, String, int) - Method in class stickypolicy.User
Creates and starts the User's server and client
StickyHeader - Class in stickypolicy
This class stores user data along with the related user policy
StickyHeader(String, Policy) - Constructor for class stickypolicy.StickyHeader
Class constructor that creates a new StickyHeader with the provided data and policy
StickyHeader(StickyHeader) - Constructor for class stickypolicy.StickyHeader
Class constructor which creates a copy of the given StickyHeader
stickypolicy - package stickypolicy
 
storeData(UserData, int) - Static method in class stickypolicy.ServiceProvider
Adds a UserData object to the database with specified number of copies

T

toString() - Method in class stickypolicy.StickyHeader
Returns the String representation of the data stored in the StickyHeader

U

uploadData(String) - Method in class stickypolicy.User
Uploads a piece of user data along with the user's policy as a Message to the ServiceProvider
User - Class in stickypolicy
This class simulates a User with a policy for how the user wants his or her data handled
User(Policy) - Constructor for class stickypolicy.User
Class constructor for creating a User which requires a User Policy
UserData - Class in stickypolicy
This class stores User data along with metadata.
UserData(StickyHeader, int) - Constructor for class stickypolicy.UserData
Class constructor creates a new UserData object with provided StickyHeader and hash and a timestamp at the time of creation.
UserServer - Class in stickypolicy
This class creates a server for the User to continuously recieve messages from the ServiceProvider
UserServer(int) - Constructor for class stickypolicy.UserServer
Class constructor initializes the ServerSocket
